definition:
[**Definition**]{} A [**zero vector space**]{} is a vector space that
contains only one element, a zero vector.

### Properties

1.  Every vector space has a zero vector space as a vector subspace.

2.  A vector space $X$ is a zero vector space if and only if the
    dimension of $X$ is zero.

3.  Any linear map defined on a zero vector space is the zero map. If
    $T$ is linear on $\{0\}$, then $T(0)=T(0\cdot 0) = 0T(0)=0$.
